revised_title: Observations on the Eclipse of the Moon and Determining Longitude
tldr: Dr. Halley observed the lunar eclipse of June 18, 1722, and used his micrometer to measure the parts of the Moon affected by the eclipse. He determined the longitude of Port Royal in Jamaica based on the eclipse observations. The eclipse began at 12:59:55 and ended around 15:27 minutes. This observation helped improve the accuracy of timekeeping and astronomical measurements.
